publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3334 Margaret Jamieson: 40th Anniversary of Ataxia UK—That the Parliament congratulates Ataxia UK on its 40th anniversary on 25 September 2005 and commends Louise Hunter of Kilmarnock who has written a book entitled Hey, I’m Alive which describes her life as a sufferer of Friedreich’s Ataxia, the proceeds of which will be donated to the continuing research by Ataxia UK into neurological disorders and to the information and support it provides to sufferers and their families.

S2M-3334 Margaret Jamieson: 40th Anniversary of Ataxia UK—That the Parliament congratulates Ataxia UK on its 40th anniversary on 25 September 2005 and commends Louise Hunter of Kilmarnock who has written a book entitled Hey, I’m Alive which describes her life as a sufferer of Friedreich’s Ataxia, the proceeds of which will be donated to the continuing research by Ataxia UK into neurological disorders and to the information and support it provides to sufferers and their families.
S2M-3334 40th Anniversary of Ataxia UK (lodged on 22 September 2005) Sarah Boyack*, Donald Gorrie*
